      the String of characters to measure

    Returns number

    the calculated width

    Inherited from p5InstanceExtensions.textWidth

    • Defined in node_modules/@types/p5/src/typography/attributes.d.ts:107

textWrap

  • textWrap(wrapStyle): string

  • Specifies how lines of text are wrapped within a text box. This requires a max-width set on the text area, specified in text() as parameter x2. WORD wrap style only breaks lines at spaces. A single string without spaces that exceeds the boundaries of the canvas or text area is not truncated, and will overflow the desired area, disappearing at the canvas edge.

    CHAR wrap style breaks lines wherever needed to stay within the text box.

    WORD is the default wrap style, and both styles will still break lines at any line breaks (\n) specified in the original text. The text area max-height parameter (y2) also still applies to wrapped text in both styles, lines of text that do not fit within the text area will not be drawn to the screen.

    Parameters

    • wrapStyle: WRAP_STYLE

      text wrapping style, either WORD or CHAR

    Returns string

    wrapStyle

    Inherited from p5InstanceExtensions.textWrap

    • Defined in node_modules/@types/p5/src/typography/attributes.d.ts:149

texture

  • texture(tex): p5

  • Sets the texture that will be used to render subsequent shapes. A texture is like a "skin" that wraps around a 3D geometry. Currently supported textures are images, video, and offscreen renders.

    To texture a geometry created with beginShape(), you will need to specify uv coordinates in vertex().

    Note, texture() can only be used in WEBGL mode.

    You can view more materials in this example.

    Parameters

    • tex: Image | Graphics | MediaElement | Framebuffer

      image to use as texture

    Returns p5

    Chainable

    Inherited from p5InstanceExtensions.texture

    • Defined in node_modules/@types/p5/src/webgl/material.d.ts:84

textureMode

  • textureMode(mode): void

  • Sets the coordinate space for texture mapping. The default mode is IMAGE which refers to the actual coordinates of the image. NORMAL refers to a normalized space of values ranging from 0 to 1. With IMAGE, if an image is 100200 pixels, mapping the image onto the entire size of a quad would require the points (0,0) (100, 0) (100,200) (0,200). The same mapping in NORMAL is (0,0) (1,0) (1,1) (0,1).

    Parameters

    • mode: TEXTURE_MODE

      either IMAGE or NORMAL

    Returns void

    Inherited from p5InstanceExtensions.textureMode

    • Defined in node_modules/@types/p5/src/webgl/material.d.ts:98

textureWrap

  • textureWrap(wrapX, wrapY?): void

  • Sets the global texture wrapping mode. This controls how textures behave when their uv's go outside of the 0 to 1 range. There are three options: CLAMP, REPEAT, and MIRROR. CLAMP causes the pixels at the edge of the texture to extend to the bounds. REPEAT causes the texture to tile repeatedly until reaching the bounds. MIRROR works similarly to REPEAT but it flips the texture with every new tile.

    REPEAT & MIRROR are only available if the texture is a power of two size (128, 256, 512, 1024, etc.).

    This method will affect all textures in your sketch until a subsequent textureWrap() call is made.

    If only one argument is provided, it will be applied to both the horizontal and vertical axes.

    Parameters

    • wrapX: WRAP_X

      either CLAMP, REPEAT, or MIRROR

    • Optional wrapY: WRAP_Y

      either CLAMP, REPEAT, or MIRROR

    Returns void

    Inherited from p5InstanceExtensions.textureWrap

    • Defined in node_modules/@types/p5/src/webgl/material.d.ts:124

tint

  • tint(v1, v2, v3, alpha?): void

  • Sets the fill value for displaying images. Images can be tinted to specified colors or made transparent by including an alpha value. To apply transparency to an image without affecting its color, use white as the tint color and specify an alpha value. For instance, tint(255, 128) will make an image 50% transparent (assuming the default alpha range of 0-255, which can be changed with colorMode()).

    The value for the gray parameter must be less than or equal to the current maximum value as specified by colorMode(). The default maximum value is 255.

    Parameters

    • v1: number

      red or hue value relative to the current color range

    • v2: number

      green or saturation value relative to the current color range

    • v3: number

      blue or brightness value relative to the current color range

    • Optional alpha: number

    Returns void

    Inherited from p5InstanceExtensions.tint

    • Defined in node_modules/@types/p5/src/image/loading_displaying.d.ts:208
  • tint(value): void

  • Sets the fill value for displaying images. Images can be tinted to specified colors or made transparent by including an alpha value. To apply transparency to an image without affecting its color, use white as the tint color and specify an alpha value. For instance, tint(255, 128) will make an image 50% transparent (assuming the default alpha range of 0-255, which can be changed with colorMode()).

    The value for the gray parameter must be less than or equal to the current maximum value as specified by colorMode(). The default maximum value is 255.

    Parameters

    • value: string

      a color string

    Returns void

    Inherited from p5InstanceExtensions.tint

    • Defined in node_modules/@types/p5/src/image/loading_displaying.d.ts:226

    • Optional alpha: number

  • Sets the fill value for displaying images. Images can be tinted to specified colors or made transparent by including an alpha value. To apply transparency to an image without affecting its color, use white as the tint color and specify an alpha value. For instance, tint(255, 128) will make an image 50% transparent (assuming the default alpha range of 0-255, which can be changed with colorMode()).

    The value for the gray parameter must be less than or equal to the current maximum value as specified by colorMode(). The default maximum value is 255.

For instance, tint(255, 128) will make an image 50% transparent (assuming the default alpha range of 0-255, which can be changed with colorMode()).

    • Defined in node_modules/@types/p5/src/image/loading_displaying.d.ts:281

torus

  • torus(radius?, tubeRadius?, detailX?, detailY?): p5

  • Draw a torus with given radius and tube radius DetailX and detailY determine the number of subdivisions in the x-dimension and the y-dimension of a torus. More subdivisions make the torus appear to be smoother. The default and maximum values for detailX and detailY are 24 and 16, respectively. Setting them to relatively small values like 4 and 6 allows you to create new shapes other than a torus.

    Parameters

    • Optional radius: number

      radius of the whole ring

    • Optional tubeRadius: number

      radius of the tube

    • Optional detailX: number

      number of segments in x-dimension, the more segments the smoother geometry default is 24

    • Optional detailY: number

      number of segments in y-dimension, the more segments the smoother geometry default is 16

    Returns p5

    Chainable

    Inherited from p5InstanceExtensions.torus

    • Defined in node_modules/@types/p5/src/webgl/3d_primitives.d.ts:140

touchEnded

  • touchEnded(event?): void

  • The touchEnded() function is called every time a touch ends. If no touchEnded() function is defined, the mouseReleased() function will be called instead if it is defined. Browsers may have different default behaviors attached to various touch events. To prevent any default behavior for this event, add "return false" to the end of the method.

    Parameters

    • Optional event: object

      optional TouchEvent callback argument.

    Returns void

    Inherited from p5InstanceExtensions.touchEnded

    • Defined in node_modules/@types/p5/src/events/touch.d.ts:47

touchMoved

  • touchMoved(event?): void

  • The touchMoved() function is called every time a touch move is registered. If no touchMoved() function is defined, the mouseDragged() function will be called instead if it is defined. Browsers may have different default behaviors attached to various touch events. To prevent any default behavior for this event, add "return false" to the end of the method.

    Parameters

    • Optional event: object

      optional TouchEvent callback argument.

    Returns void

    Inherited from p5InstanceExtensions.touchMoved

    • Defined in node_modules/@types/p5/src/events/touch.d.ts:33

touchStarted

  • touchStarted(event?): void

  • The touchStarted() function is called once after every time a touch is registered. If no touchStarted() function is defined, the mousePressed() function will be called instead if it is defined. Browsers may have different default behaviors attached to various touch events. To prevent any default behavior for this event, add "return false" to the end of the method.

    Parameters

    • Optional event: object

      optional TouchEvent callback argument.

    Returns void

    Inherited from p5InstanceExtensions.touchStarted

    • Defined in node_modules/@types/p5/src/events/touch.d.ts:19

translate

  • translate(x, y, z?): p5

  • Specifies an amount to displace objects within the display window. The x parameter specifies left/right translation, the y parameter specifies up/down translation. Transformations are cumulative and apply to everything that happens after and subsequent calls to the function accumulates the effect. For example, calling translate(50, 0) and then translate(20, 0) is the same as translate(70, 0). If translate() is called within draw(), the transformation is reset when the loop begins again. This function can be further controlled by using push() and pop().

    Parameters

    • x: number

      left/right translation

    • y: number

      up/down translation

    • Optional z: number

      forward/backward translation (WEBGL only)

    Returns p5

    Chainable

    Inherited from p5InstanceExtensions.translate

    • Defined in node_modules/@types/p5/src/core/transform.d.ts:311
  • translate(vector): p5

  • Specifies an amount to displace objects within the display window. The x parameter specifies left/right translation, the y parameter specifies up/down translation. Transformations are cumulative and apply to everything that happens after and subsequent calls to the function accumulates the effect. For example, calling translate(50, 0) and then translate(20, 0) is the same as translate(70, 0). If translate() is called within draw(), the transformation is reset when the loop begins again. This function can be further controlled by using push() and pop().

    Parameters

    • vector: Vector

      the vector to translate by

    Returns p5

    Chainable

    Inherited from p5InstanceExtensions.translate

    • Defined in node_modules/@types/p5/src/core/transform.d.ts:329

triangle

  • triangle(x1, y1, x2, y2, x3, y3): p5

  • Draws a triangle to the canvas. A triangle is a three-sided polygon. The first two parameters specify the triangle's first point (x1,y1). The middle two parameters specify its second point (x2,y2). And the last two parameters specify its third point (x3, y3).

    Parameters

    • x1: number

      x-coordinate of the first point.

    • y1: number

      y-coordinate of the first point.

    • x2: number

      x-coordinate of the second point.

    • y2: number

      y-coordinate of the second point.

    • x3: number

      x-coordinate of the third point.

    • y3: number

      y-coordinate of the third point.

    Returns p5

    Chainable

    Inherited from p5InstanceExtensions.triangle

    • Defined in node_modules/@types/p5/src/core/shape/2d_primitives.d.ts:393

    • Defined in node_modules/@types/p5/src/utilities/conversion.d.ts:195

updatePixels

  • updatePixels(x?, y?, w?, h?): void

  • Updates the display window with the data in the pixels[] array. Use in conjunction with loadPixels(). If you're only reading pixels from the array, there's no need to call updatePixels() updating is only necessary to apply changes. updatePixels() should be called anytime the pixels array is manipulated or set() is called, and only changes made with set() or direct changes to pixels[] will occur.

    Parameters

    • Optional x: number

      x-coordinate of the upper-left corner of region to update

    • Optional y: number

      y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of region to update

    • Optional w: number

      width of region to update

    • Optional h: number

      height of region to update

    Returns void

    Inherited from p5InstanceExtensions.updatePixels

    • Defined in node_modules/@types/p5/src/image/pixels.d.ts:346

vertex

  • vertex(x, y): p5

  • All shapes are constructed by connecting a series of vertices. vertex() is used to specify the vertex coordinates for points, lines, triangles, quads, and polygons. It is used exclusively within the beginShape() and endShape() functions.

    Parameters

    • x: number

      x-coordinate of the vertex

    • y: number

      y-coordinate of the vertex

    Returns p5

    Chainable

    Inherited from p5InstanceExtensions.vertex

    • Defined in node_modules/@types/p5/src/core/shape/vertex.d.ts:287
  • vertex(x, y, z?): p5

  • All shapes are constructed by connecting a series of vertices. vertex() is used to specify the vertex coordinates for points, lines, triangles, quads, and polygons. It is used exclusively within the beginShape() and endShape() functions.

    Parameters

    • x: number

      x-coordinate of the vertex

    • y: number

      y-coordinate of the vertex

    • Optional z: number

      z-coordinate of the vertex. Defaults to 0 if not specified.

    Returns p5

    Chainable

    Inherited from p5InstanceExtensions.vertex

    • Defined in node_modules/@types/p5/src/core/shape/vertex.d.ts:301
  • vertex(x, y, z?, u?, v?): p5

  • All shapes are constructed by connecting a series of vertices. vertex() is used to specify the vertex coordinates for points, lines, triangles, quads, and polygons. It is used exclusively within the beginShape() and endShape() functions.

    Parameters

    • x: number

      x-coordinate of the vertex

    • y: number

      y-coordinate of the vertex

    • Optional z: number

      z-coordinate of the vertex. Defaults to 0 if not specified.

    • Optional u: number

      the vertex's texture u-coordinate

    • Optional v: number

      the vertex's texture v-coordinate

    Returns p5

    Chainable

    Inherited from p5InstanceExtensions.vertex

    • Defined in node_modules/@types/p5/src/core/shape/vertex.d.ts:317

vertexNormal

  • vertexNormal(x, y, z, v): p5

  • Sets the normal to use for subsequent vertices.

    Parameters

    • x: number
    • y: number
    • z: number
    • v: Vector

    Returns p5

    Chainable

    Inherited from p5InstanceExtensions.vertexNormal

    • Defined in node_modules/@types/p5/src/webgl/p5.RendererGL.Immediate.d.ts:11

windowResized

  • windowResized(event?): void

  • The windowResized() function is called once every time the browser window is resized. This is a good place to resize the canvas or do any other adjustments to accommodate the new window size.

    Parameters

    • Optional event: object

      optional Event callback argument.

    Returns void

    Inherited from p5InstanceExtensions.windowResized

    • Defined in node_modules/@types/p5/src/core/environment.d.ts:121

year

  • year(): number

  • p5.js communicates with the clock on your computer. The year() function returns the current year as an integer (2014, 2015, 2016, etc).

    Returns number

    the current year

    Inherited from p5InstanceExtensions.year

    • Defined in node_modules/@types/p5/src/utilities/time_date.d.ts:63

Brick Game - v0.4.0
  • Game Body
    Responsable to handle all the GameBrick's body events and rendering it
    • BodyElements
      Responsable for rendering the body elements, like: buttons, display and etc
    • GameBody
      Responsable for rendering the gamebrick body, bound and unbound controls events
    • BodyProps
      Used as arguments in the BodyElements and GameBody constructors
  • Game Constants
    Defines all constants used in the game engine
    • gameConstants
  • Game Engine
    Responsible for defining all standard behaviors, managing status, rendering the game screen and controlling the score and record
    • Color
      Enumerates all available cell's colors
    • FontAlign
      Enumerates all available font aligns when using the game utilities for writing text on screen
    • FontSize
      Enumerates all available font sizes when using the game utilities for writing text on screen
    • Sound
      Enumerates all available sound effects
    • Game
    • GameControls
    • GameSound
    • Cell
      Represents a game's display cell
    • CellElement
      Used as argument to draw an individual cell
    • Coordinates
      Represents a 2D coordinate.
    • GameItem
      Represents a Game on the initial menu
    • GameProps
      Used as argument in the Game constructor
    • GameState
      Describes all posible states of a game in runtime
  • P5.js Framework
    For better reference documentation: https://p5js.org/reference/
    • p5
